meanings.definition: To spend more money than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: She outspent her friend on a new dress.
meanings.sent2: The company outspent its competitors on advertising.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outspent the other animals at the nut store.
meanings.sent4: The marathon runner outspent his energy too early in the race.
meanings.sent5: The student outspent his allowance on video games in just one day.

meanings.definition: Having spent more money than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The outspent team struggled to keep up with their opponents.
meanings.sent2: She felt outspent after splurging on a luxury vacation.
meanings.sent3: The outspent car looked impressive but had no gas left.
meanings.sent4: The outspent wallet was a clear sign of a shopping spree.
meanings.sent5: The outspent budget left little room for unexpected expenses.
